title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 9.126 - Executive Order No. 126: Continuing the Declaration of Disaster Emergency
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 9.126 - Executive Order No. 126: Continuing the Declaration of Disaster Emergency

State Regulations
WHEREAS, pursuant to Executive Order 211, issued July 6, 2021, a statewide disaster was declared across the State due to gun
violence; NOW, THEREFORE, I, KATHY HOCHUL, Governor of the State of

New York, by virtue of the authority vested in me by the Constitution and

Article 2-B of the Executive Law, do hereby extend the state disaster emergency
as set forth in Executive Order 211, as continued in Executive Order 3.27, and
continue the terms, conditions, and suspensions contained in Executive Order
211 and its successors, until February 4, 2024. (L.S.) GIVEN under my hand and the Privy Seal of the State
in the City of Albany this fifth day of January in the year two thousand
twenty-four. BY THE GOVERNOR
/S/ Kathy Hochul
/s/ Karen Persichilli Keogh

Secretary to the

Governor

Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9

9.126

Adopted

New

York State Register January 31, 2024/Volume XLVI, Issue 5, eff. 1/31/2024

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
